You can use this trait to take the Help action as a bonus action, and you can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
   Starting at 3rd level, your help confers additional benefits. Choose one of the options below each time you take the Help action, whether as a bonus action or an action:

  • Hospitality. You and the target of your Help action each gain a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d6 plus your proficiency bonus.
  • Passage. You and the target of your Help action can each immediately move 10 feet without provoking attacks of opportunity and at no movement cost. A creature does not gain this benefit if it has a condition that reduces its speed to 0 or prevents movement.
  • Dominance. Within the next minute, the first attack against you and the target of your Help action are both made at disadvantage.
